intro: Diasperus gunnii, commonly known as the Gunns' flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in the lower and middle parts of the New Zealand coastline. Diasperus gunnii is a hardy species that thrives in maritime climates with high salt exposure.
